headline: Podcast: AMD Leads Stocks Higher After Its Deal With Meta Platforms
summary: Stocks rebound despite President Trump's new global tariffs. The gains occur as Meta Platforms agrees to buy more than $100 billion in artificial-computing power from Advanced Micro Devices. Plus, Home Depot shares gain as the home-improvement retailer posts strong quarterly results.

headline: Heard on the Street Recap: Meta Pivot
summary: Early Tuesday, Meta Platforms announced a deal valued at more than $100 billion to purchase artificial-intelligence chips from AMD, sending shares in the Nvidia rival over 8% higher.  Gold futures retreated as investors shifted back into equities.  Market attention is turning to President Trump’s State of the Union address Tuesday evening.

raw.headline: Heard on the Street Recap: Meta Pivot
raw.summary: Early Tuesday, Meta Platforms announced a deal valued at more than $100 billion to purchase artificial-intelligence chips from AMD, sending shares in the Nvidia rival over 8% higher.  Gold futures retreated as investors shifted back into equities.  Market attention is turning to President Trump’s State of the Union address Tuesday evening.

headline: Nasdaq Bounces Back After AMD-Meta Deal on AI Chips
summary: Improved consumer-confidence numbers and an announcement by Anthropic about tools that could potentially be used in combination with existing software—rather than as a replacement—also helped bolster market optimism, said  Shannon Saccocia,  chief investment officer of wealth at Neuberger Berman.  The Nasdaq composite advanced 1%, while the S&P 500 and Dow industrials were both up 0.8%.  With so much unknown about how AI will affect business, the first two months of 2026 have been a near daily fight between Wall Street’s bulls and bears, said  Jay Hatfield,  chief executive officer at Infrastructure Capital Advisors.

With so much unknown about how AI will affect business, the first two months of 2026 have been a near daily fight between Wall Street’s bulls and bears, said  Jay Hatfield,  chief executive officer at Infrastructure Capital Advisors.

headline: Meta strikes massive 6-gigawatt AI chip deal with AMD
summary: Meta Platforms (META) landed a multi-year, 6-gigawatt GPU deal with chipmaker Advanced Micro Devices (AMD). Yahoo Finance Technology Editor Dan Howley joins Market Domination host Josh Lipton to discuss the details of the agreement and how AMD directly competes with Nvidia (NVDA) in the AI infrastructure buildout. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination.

headline: Meta-AMD deal reflects 'complexity' of AI ecosystem, says investor
summary: STORY: Advanced Micro Devices said on Tuesday it has agreed to sell up to $60 billion worth of artificial intelligence chips to Meta Platforms META.O over five years in a deal that allows the Facebook owner to purchase as much as 10% of the chip firm."We continue to have these cross-currents, or you've heard them referenced as circularity types of arrangements in terms of capital structure and money between these companies that are buying goods and services from one another," Mussio said.While a "net positive" for AMD, Mussio wondered whether this type of complex deal structure would lead investors to "pull on a string and see how far that ball of yarn unwinds."

raw.headline: Meta-AMD deal reflects 'complexity' of AI ecosystem, says investor
raw.summary: STORY: Advanced Micro Devices said on Tuesday it has agreed to sell up to $60 billion worth of artificial intelligence chips to Meta Platforms META.O over five years in a deal that allows the Facebook owner to purchase as much as 10% of the chip firm."We continue to have these cross-currents, or you've heard them referenced as circularity types of arrangements in terms of capital structure and money between these companies that are buying goods and services from one another," Mussio said.While a "net positive" for AMD, Mussio wondered whether this type of complex deal structure would lead investors to "pull on a string and see how far that ball of yarn unwinds."

headline: How major US stock indexes fared Tuesday, 2/24/2026
summary: The U.S. stock market rose after getting a reminder that the artificial-intelligence technology boom may also have an upside. The S&P 500 climbed 0.8% Tuesday and recovered nearly three-quarters of its loss from the day before, when worries worsened that AI could make some businesses and industries obsolete. The Dow Jones Industrial Average rose 0.8%, and the Nasdaq composite gained 1%.

The Dow Jones Industrial Average rose 0.8%, and the Nasdaq composite gained 1%.

headline: China has not yet received any Nvidia H200 chips, US official said
summary: None of Nvidia's second-most advanced AI chips, known as the ‌H200, have been sold yet to ‌Chinese customers, a U.S. Commerce Department official said on Tuesday.  "My ​understanding is that none so far," Commerce Assistant Secretary for Export Enforcement David Peters said at a congressional hearing when asked about the ‌prized semiconductors.  The Chinese ⁠Embassy in Washington and Nvidia did not immediately respond to requests for comment.

headline: Meta to Spend Billions of Dollars on AMD Gear, Buy Stock
summary: Meta Platforms Inc. will deploy 6 gigawatts' worth of data center gear based on processors from Advanced Micro Devices Inc., a blockbuster deal that marks a win for the chipmaker's attempts to catch up with Nvidia Corp. Meta will buy AMD chips and computers designed to run artificial intelligence models over a five-year stretch, beginning in the second half of 2026. The series of transactions will be worth "double-digit billions" of dollars per gigawatt, according to AMD Chief Executive Officer Lisa Su. Bloomberg's Ed Ludlow joins to discuss with Paul Sweeney and Scarlet Fu.

raw.headline: Meta to Spend Billions of Dollars on AMD Gear, Buy Stock

The series of transactions will be worth "double-digit billions" of dollars per gigawatt, according to AMD Chief Executive Officer Lisa Su. Bloomberg's Ed Ludlow joins to discuss with Paul Sweeney and Scarlet Fu.

headline: AMD CEO Says Meta Stock Deal Ties Company to a Market Leader
summary: Advanced Micro Devices Chief Executive Lisa Su said allowing Meta Platforms to buy as much as 10% of her company’s stock as part of a new partnership announced Tuesday is a “win-win from our shareholders' standpoint.”  The arrangement, which gives Meta warrants to buy up to 160 million AMD shares, ensures the chip maker will have a long-term partner with one of the leaders in AI development, she said in an interview with CNBC.  Meta has also agreed to buy 6 gigawatts’ worth of artificial intelligence computing power from AMD.

raw.headline: AMD CEO Says Meta Stock Deal Ties Company to a Market Leader

Meta has also agreed to buy 6 gigawatts’ worth of artificial intelligence computing power from AMD.

headline: AMD, Meta's $100B AI deal is a 'shot across the bow' for Nvidia
summary: Meta Platforms (META) announced a new AI chip partnership with Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) that is reported to be worth $100 billion. Sevens Report Research founder Tom Essaye joins the live show with Yahoo Finance Markets and Data Editor Jared Blikre, and Yahoo Finance Senior Markets Reporter Ines Ferré to break down the deal, saying it is "a shot across the bow" for Nvidia (NVDA), as chipmakers compete aggressively for a limited pool of hyperscaler customers building out AI data centers. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Opening Bid.

headline: AMD secures Meta as next big AI chip customer
summary: Advanced Micro Devices said on Tuesday it has agreed to sell up to $60 billion worth of artificial intelligence chips to Meta Platforms over five years in a deal that allows the Facebook owner to purchase as much as 10% of the chip firm.  The company had signed a similar pact with ‌OpenAI last year, which was hailed as a vote of confidence in its chips and software, significantly boosting its stock price.

headline: Sigma Doubles ARR in 12 Months as Markets Shift from Dashboards to AI-Powered Workflows
summary: SAN FRANCISCO, February 24, 2026--Sigma, a leader in AI applications for business, today announced preliminary business results for the fiscal year ending January 31, 2026, highlighting record momentum in revenue and customer adoption. Sigma achieved ARR growth of more than 100% year over year, driven by both new customer demand and expanding usage across existing enterprises.

Sigma achieved ARR growth of more than 100% year over year, driven by both new customer demand and expanding usage across existing enterprises.

headline: Facebook owner Meta to buy AI chips from AMD in deal worth up to $100 billion
summary: Facebook owner Meta Platforms will buy artificial intelligence chips from Advanced Micro Devices in a deal that will also give it the opportunity to buy up to a 10% stake of the chip company.  Meta will buy AMD's latest chips, the MI450, to help power data centers.  The companies said that AMD issued Meta a performance-based warrant for up to 160 million shares of its common stock at $0.01 a piece, structured to vest as long as certain milestones are achieved.

Meta will buy AMD's latest chips, the MI450, to help power data centers.  The companies said that AMD issued Meta a performance-based warrant for up to 160 million shares of its common stock at $0.01 a piece, structured to vest as long as certain milestones are achieved.

headline: Nvidia results are AI market's biggest test amid competitive worries
summary: As Nvidia heads into quarterly earnings on Wednesday, AI investors are seeking evidence that the chipmaker's profits are growing apace on the back of a $630 billion capital spending budget from Big Tech.  After powering much of the U.S. stock market rally for the past three years, Nvidia's stock has risen ‌just about 2% so far in 2026.  Google is also in talks to supply Meta - a large Nvidia customer, according to media reports.

headline: A Look At Riot Platforms (RIOT) Valuation As Activist Pressure Meets New AMD AI Data Center Deal
summary: Riot Platforms (RIOT) is in the spotlight after activist investor Starboard Value pushed for a faster pivot from Bitcoin mining to AI and high performance computing, as Riot advances a long term Texas data center lease with AMD. See our latest analysis for Riot Platforms. Riot’s latest share price of US$15.65 comes after a 1 year total shareholder return of 56.66% and a 3 year total shareholder return of about 2.6x. Its 30 day share price return of a 9.43% decline contrasts with a 10.52% gain...

headline: Wall Street points toward gains after heavy selling to start the week
summary: Wall Street appears to be positioned for rebound Tuesday following an artificial intelligence sell-off a day earlier. Futures for the S&P 500 gained 0.1% while futures for the Dow Jones Industrial Average rose 0.2%. Nasdaq futures were up 0.3% before the opening bell.
